fields.Title: PLAZA ORB / mullen mistaken identity conclusion
fields.Description: the afterthought where you learn it all...
fields.Placement:
Area: on plaza near annette, or the thought bubble area should be wide enough to cover both the entrance of the bookstore and the side exit/entrance to the doomed cellar.
Details:

fields.Title: START
input
Electrochemistry: "Or *MORE* speed!"
fields.Dialogue Text: Or *MORE* speed!

fields.Title: You: "It was love did them in."
fields.Dialogue Text: It was love did them in.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "So, who killed Charlie Spillane and..."
fields.Dialogue Text: So, who killed Charlie Spillane and Deanna Deneuve, detective? Just fucking pick one.

fields.Title: Logic: "There isn't. If only you had more t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There isn't. If only you had more time... more resources... who knows what you could have come up with?

fields.Title: Logic: "Okay, sure. A defunct political ide..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Okay, sure. A defunct political ideology came and murdered a couple of people. History repeats itself, and the whole cycle starts again...

fields.Title: You: "The junkie art collector."
fields.Dialogue Text: The junkie art collector.

fields.Title: You: "Fuck you, book! It *was* Dick Mulle..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Fuck you, book! It *was* Dick Mullen.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "You've seen it yourself, haven't yo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You've seen it yourself, haven't you? Maybe that cuts a little close to the bone, *jaded cop*. Take it easy -- Don't let the memory of old betrayals haunt you tonight.

fields.Title: Logic: "Give up. You'll never find the answ..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Give up. You'll never find the answer. There's no other copy of "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity" here.

fields.Title: Logic: "Sounds good. You can't trust the fu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sounds good. You can't trust the fuzz, after all. They *say* they've got your back, but do they *really?* More like they've got a *knife* in your back.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Well done, ace detective. You put a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Well done, ace detective. You put a dangerous junkie *and* art collector behind bars -- two birds with one stone! Now put your feet up and take a breather.

fields.Title: You: "The dirty police captain."
fields.Dialogue Text: The dirty police captain.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Why not? Love gets a lot of people..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Why not? Love gets a lot of people killed... Speaking of, aren't you a little close to the edge, yourself, lover-cop? Better lay off that love stuff, if you can.

fields.Title: the final countdown
Logic: "Because that's how the world works...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Because that's how the world works. Some stories never get finished. You shouldn't expect there to be a tidy, satisfying ending.

fields.Title: Logic: "Maybe if there had been more money...."
fields.Dialogue Text: Maybe if there had been more money... and less speed...

fields.Title: Logic: "Or *that*, yes. Either way, you mig..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Or *that*, yes. Either way, you might've been able to come up with an answer. But not like this.

fields.Title: Logic: "Sure, why not? Everyone knows polit..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sure, why not? Everyone knows politicians are corrupt, and what's more corrupt than letting your entitled spawn run around offing people?

fields.Title: Logic: "It makes sense: Junkies and art col..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It makes sense: Junkies and art collectors both need a steady stream of income, and what better way to generate income than... murdering a couple of people.

fields.Title: You: "I guess that's it. Maybe it's bette..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I guess that's it. Maybe it's better this way. [Finish thought.]

fields.Title: Logic: "Sure, yes. They died of an over-abu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sure, yes. They died of an over-abundance of love. Just loved each other to death. Couldn't get enough love. And now they're dead.

fields.Title: You: "There's got to be a way to solve th..."
fields.Dialogue Text: There's got to be a way to solve this.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Case closed, and with no time to sp..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Case closed, and with no time to spare. Ideologies are dangerous, but communism won't be troubling the people anymore -- all thanks to you, politico-detective.

fields.Title: You: "Wait, I've got it: It was *communis..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Wait, I've got it: It was *communism*.

fields.Title: You: "Man, what a disappointment. [Finish..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Man, what a disappointment. [Finish thought.]

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Doesn't matter. The choice has been..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Doesn't matter. The choice has been made. You caught the criminal -- It was Dick Mullen all along. Who's the real detective now? That's right, it's you. Rest easy tonight, *real detective*.

fields.Title: You: "The politician's twat son."
fields.Dialogue Text: The politician's twat son.

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Hang on, you can do this. *Use your..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Hang on, you can do this. *Use your imagination*. You know who the suspects are, just... make it up.

fields.Title: Inland Empire: "But... but... what if you never fin..."
fields.Dialogue Text: But... but... what if you never find out how *your* story ends?

fields.Title: Logic: "It still doesn't make sense, but wh..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It still doesn't make sense, but who cares? Yes, Dick Mullen, the famous detective, killed his best friend and a dame he just nailed in cold blood. But why'd he do it? Unclear!

fields.Title: Variable["plaza.orb_mullen_conclusion_concept_ending"]
Variable["plaza.orb_mullen_conclusion_concept_ending"]
!(Variable["plaza.orb_mullen_conclusion_concept_ending"])
Variable["plaza.orb_mullenconclusion_electro_speed"]
Variable["plaza.orb_mullenconclusion_electro_speed"]
!(Variable["plaza.orb_mullenconclusion_electro_speed"])
Conceptualization: "Way to go, public corruption cop. Y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Way to go, public corruption cop. You've seen first-hand how the powerful tip the scales of justice in their favour, but today you tipped them back *just a little*. You can rest easy tonight.

fields.Title: You: "But, why?"
fields.Dialogue Text: But, why?
